replies.msg:
我覺得一、兩成靠睇片之類，八成靠睇書或者其他網上資料，維基又好，law teacher又好，叫做有少少概念，之前齋睇module guide同text book睇左一個月都唔知做緊乜

利申：讀歷史出身，英文一般般，自己悟性又不足，巴打可能好啲

頭一個sem想揀2科最易上手既黎讀 有冇話邊科入門啲？

唔該曬巴打
我報左graduate entry route
純為興趣 冇打算𢴇葉
想問以下幾科邊2科比較易上手？
Contract law* | Criminal law* | Equity and Trusts*
EU law* | Property law* | Public law* | Tort law*
其實只有Contract law / Criminal law / Public law揀得落手
唔係一定要讀完contract criminal public 先可唔可讀其他咩？個人覺得public 太抽象但少case背，如果想知自己啱唔啱讀落去都係contract criminal吧

replies.msg:
我之前都冇仔細睇
你啱，得嗰三科係Level 4，所以graduate route分三年讀嘅話只會揀依三科

之前只知道讀EU Law及Admin Law前應該讀Public Law

我個人感覺Contract Law最體現普通法原則，所以不論係standard/graduate route都應該將Contract Law放最先

Equity and Trusts及Property Law係姊妹科，喺第二或三學年一齊讀就最好

replies.msg:
prolly better to do in two diff years

otoh, land in UK is registered land. this is very different from the mostly unregistered land system in hk. i don't know enough about hk laws to speak on the subject (i had licence to practice medicine not laws in hk), but let's just say that it is dangerous to study law in once place then practice in another. the conversion exam is easy, but...

i quote an example which i laughed my ass off when i first read it...
"Hong Kong has a piece of home-grown legislation that may catch out the unwary. It is the Transfer of Businesses (Protection of Creditors) Ordinance , Cap 49 (“ TBPCO ”), and it imposes liability for past debts upon anybody who takes over the business of another."

quote.msg: 真係好撚辛苦，除左訓覺都唔返屋企，日日去圖書館溫書，屌那媽

一個sem考三科 考前大半個月先開始認真睇 都pass到仲要public law睇左一星期only
係我有天份定點

replies.msg: 我自認柒我有個朋友英文超勁，讀到閪咁都係得third hon
